quiz.title: Grade 12 Advanced Mechanics
quiz.subtitle: Unit 3, Quiz 12: Final SHM & Waves Review
quiz.subject: Physics

questions.question: The ratio of maximum acceleration to maximum velocity in SHM is $10\text{ s}^{-1}$. At $t=0$ the displacement is $5\text{ m}$ and the initial phase is $\pi/4$. What is the maximum acceleration?
questions.explanation: $a_{max}/v_{max} = \omega^2 A / (\omega A) = \omega = 10\text{ rad/s}$. At $t=0$: $x = A\sin\phi \Rightarrow 5 = A\sin(\pi/4) \Rightarrow A = 5\sqrt{2}\text{ m}$. $a_{max} = \omega^2 A = 100 \times 5\sqrt{2} = 500\sqrt{2}\text{ m/s}^2$.

questions.question: A child swinging on a swing in a sitting position stands up. How will the time period of the swing change?
questions.explanation: When standing, the child's center of mass rises, effectively shortening the pendulum length $L$. Since $T = 2\pi\sqrt{L/g}$, shorter length means smaller period.

questions.question: The length of a simple pendulum is increased by 21%. What is the percentage increase in the time period?
In a simple harmonic oscillator, which of the following is true at the mean position ($x=0$)?
questions.explanation: At equilibrium: displacement $x=0$, so potential energy $U = \frac{1}{2}kx^2 = 0$ (minimum). Velocity is maximum, so kinetic energy $K = \frac{1}{2}mv_{max}^2$ is maximum.

questions.question: A mass $m$ is attached to two springs of constants $k_1$ and $k_2$ in parallel. If the frequency of oscillation is $f$, what is the new frequency if they are connected in series?
The average velocity of a particle executing SHM in one complete vibration is:
questions.explanation: Average velocity = total displacement / total time. In one complete cycle, the particle returns to its starting point, so net displacement = 0, making average velocity zero.

questions.question: If a tunnel is bored along the diameter of the Earth and a stone is dropped into it, the stone will:
options: Come to rest at the center
Pass through to the other side and escape
Execute SHM with a period of ~84.6 min
Reach the center and stop due to gravity
questions.explanation: Inside Earth, gravitational force is proportional to distance from center: $F = -\frac{GMm}{R^3}r = -kr$. This linear restoring force produces SHM with period $T = 2\pi\sqrt{R/g} \approx 84.6$ minutes.

questions.question: A second's pendulum is placed in a lift falling freely under gravity. Its period of oscillation will be:
questions.explanation: In free fall, effective gravity $g_{eff} = g - g = 0$. Period $T = 2\pi\sqrt{L/g_{eff}}$ becomes infinite (pendulum stops oscillating as there's no restoring torque).

questions.question: The equation of a wave is $y = 5\sin(10\pi t - 0.01\pi x)$. The velocity of the wave is:
questions.explanation: Standard form: $y = A\sin(\omega t - kx)$. Here $\omega = 10\pi$, $k = 0.01\pi$. Wave speed $v = \omega/k = 10\pi / 0.01\pi = 1000\text{ m/s}$.

questions.question: Which of the following quantities is NOT constant in SHM?
questions.explanation: Acceleration $a = -\omega^2 x$ varies with displacement $x$. Total energy, time period, and amplitude remain constant in undamped SHM.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You've mastered all aspects of SHM and waves, from basic concepts to advanced applications like Earth-tunnel oscillations and free-fall effects.
scoreMessages.70: Very good! Comprehensive understanding. Review the relationships between spring combinations, effects of changing effective gravity, and wave equation parameters.
scoreMessages.50: Fair. Focus on: 1) Calculating parameters from given ratios, 2) How length changes affect pendulum period, 3) Energy distribution in SHM, 4) Wave speed from equation, 5) Effects of changing reference frames.
scoreMessages.0: Start with the fundamentals: Review pendulum and spring-mass formulas, energy conservation in SHM, wave equation interpretation, and how acceleration varies with position.
